page.title: 18PUB LIFE IN NESSCLIFFE
page.content: It is an interesting life living in a pub. People of all kinds come into the hotel including farmers, celebrities, most off Central Television, journalists, other publicans and caterers. The highest percentage of people are locals coming in for a pint. We have 5 rooms for residents, who come from all over the world, and a TV room available. Bed and breakfast costs Â£lO.9O. We are frequently booked up but people are so desperate sometimes they sleep on the floor in sleeping bags. Bar snacks, Sunday lunches and ordinary meals are available which range from a sandwich to a T-bone steak. We serve all sorts of drinks in the bar, like Coke, Babycham, lager, mild and bitter. We also serve crisps, peanuts and chocolate bars. I like listening to the talk in the bar.
